data.body:
As Singapore’s annual pinnacle arts festival, the Singapore International Festival of Arts (SIFA) presents captivating and diverse works across theatre, music, dance, film and visual arts. First launched as the Singapore Festival of Arts in 1977, the festival has gone through several evolutions and inspired generations of arts lovers and practitioners. Today, the highly-anticipated festival is a high-point on Singapore’s arts and cultural calendar.

Under the helm of Festival Director Gaurav Kripalani from 2018–2020, SIFA continues its festival mission to champion the creation and presentation of Singaporean and international works. Festival House At SIFA 2019, The Arts House will once again be transformed into the Festival House. With meaningful engagement opportunities from artists talks, workshops, discussions and the festival bar—House Pour, the Festival House breaks down the walls between artists and audiences to create unique experiences and inspiring artistic encounters.
data.description: 3 exhilarating weeks of artistic adventures at Singapore's pinnacle arts festival
data.name: Singapore International Festival of Arts 2019

data.body: ULTRA Singapore is part of the greater Ultra Worldwide family, producer of 45 events in 20 countries across 5 continents. It is the only edition of the festival in Southeast Asia.  On the heels of its sold-out 2015 soft launch, ULTRA Singapore was upgraded to full festival status in 2016. Following a successful festival in 2016 which saw 45 000 attendees, ULTRA Singapore 2017 welcomed over 47,000 attendees from 60 countries to its iconic Marina Bay location on June 10th & 11th.  40 world class acts performed across Ultra’s triumvirate of the Main, LIVE, and Resistance Stages. Next year, we welcome the fourth edition of ULTRA Singapore, dates and venue to be released. Stay tuned!
data.description: Ultra Singapore is an outdoor electronic music festival that debuted in 2015 in Singapore as part of Ultra Music Festival's worldwide expansion, which has now spread to twenty countries.
data.name: ULTRA Singapore 2019

LAMC Productions is excited to announce that Atlanta Hip-hop Superstar and Multi-platinum trailblazer, Future, will make his anticipated debut in Singapore on May 9, 2019, at ZEPP@BIGBOX!

Future just released his anxiously awaited seventh full-length album, Future Hndrxx Presents: The WIZRD. Upon arrival, it captured a spot in the Top 5 on Apple Music Overall Top Albums Chart and #1 on Apple Music Top Hip-Hop/Rap Albums Chart where it continues to hold strong.

data.body:
Lim Cheng Hoe (1912–1979) was the leading watercolour artist of his generation and one of the founders of the Singapore Watercolour Society. Largely self-taught, he studied painting under the then-art inspector of schools, Richard Walker, and honed his skills in the 1950s and 1970s by practicing and interacting with fellow artists during outdoor painting sessions.

Beginning with the early days of his practice in the 1930s, this exhibition features over 60 artworks, sketches and archival materials that highlight Lim’s mastery of outdoor watercolour landscape painting.
data.price: General admission | Free for locals and PRs, $20 for Non-Singaporeans
data.description: Lim Cheng Hoe (1912–1979) was the leading watercolour artist of his generation and one of the founders of the Singapore Watercolour Society. Largely self-taught, he studied painting under the then-art inspector of schools, Richard Walker, and honed his skills in the 1950s and 1970s by practicing and interacting with fellow artists during outdoor painting sessions.
data.name: Lim Cheng Hoe: Painting Singapore

data.body: The International Champions Cup is the world’s premier pre-season football tournament featuring the top football clubs in the world. After launching in 2013, the tournament has revolutionised the global pre-season window with consistent delivery of mouth-watering matches to fans around the world. It is now the undisputed dominant tournament force during the critical pre-season period. Since 2017, Singapore is the only South East Asian country to host a leg of the tournament in the region, with the 2019 tournament being the third edition held here. This year, the global format will be reprised with each club playing three matches in total with the overall standings determined on a points-based system, crowning one overall global winner.
data.description: Premier pre-season football tournament featuring the world's top football clubs
data.name: International Champions Cup 2019 in Singapore

data.body:
LAMC Productions is excited to announce that SABRINA CARPENTER, will make her debut in Singapore with ‘The Singular Tour’ on Apr 11, 2019, at Kallang Theatre!


Nineteen-year-old singer, songwriter, and actor Sabrina Carpenter’s journey into music, television, and film began at an early age. Her debut album, Eyes Wide Open, released in 2015, reflected her life over the previous three years, while her sophomore album, EVOLution, released in 2016, launched her first ever sold-out fall 2016 headline EVOLution Tour, traveling across 35+ cities in the United States. In May 2017, she joined The Vamps as a special guest on their UK arena tour as well as Ariana Grande’s Dangerous Woman tour in Brazil in June before heading out on The De-Tour, her 30+ date summer headline trek in July.

Prior to The De-Tour, Carpenter co-wrote and released her RIAA-certified gold single, “Why,” which Billboard hailed as “highly promising of what’s to come,” and proved to be a hit on Top 40 radio. Carpenter’s vocals were featured on Lost Kings’ track “First Love,” released in October 2017. In 2018, she released “Alien” with Jonas Blue, which became the #1 Breakout Song on the Billboard Club chart and has amassed nearly 43 million global combined streams since its release. Most recently, she was featured on ‘The Hate U Give’, which was released in Oct 2018. She is also set to star in the upcoming independent film The Short History of the Long Road opposite Steven Ogg, Maggie Siff and Danny Trejo. Her third studio album, Singular: Act I, was released on November 9, 2018., to rave reviews!


GET YOUR TICKETS NOW!


TICKETS ARE ON SALE: https://www.sistic.com.sg/events/carpenter0419

TICKETS: S$148*, S$128*, S$108* & S$88*

*Not Including booking fees

data.body:
LA Comedy Live is excited to announce that one of India’s best standup comedian, ATUL KHATRI, will be returning to Singapore on May 2, 2019, at SOTA Concert Hall!

Khatri was listed among the top Indian comedian by CNN-IBN and was the main Indian to perform at the Hong Kong International Comedy Festival in Sept. 2014. Additionally, he is the winner of FremantleMedia’s “CEO’s Got Talent” award. Interestingly, Atul Khatri did not find his passion for comedy until he was in his forties. In 2011, Khatri decided to have a substitute profession after he was encouraged by his wife, Shaguna Khatri. Initially, he wanted to become a bartender and then later a DJ; but did not pursue either field. Khatri started his career as a comedian by posting jokes (as comic relief) on Facebook.

Many people appreciated his sense of humour and as such, he took a New Year resolution & signed up for an ‘open mic’. That’s how his career in stand-up comedy all started. Khatri has done more than 400 comedy drama shows, TV commercial, and Youtube video. He was likewise one of the 3 finalists at the Melbourne International Comedy Festival, in Delhi in 2012. Atul additionally, performs at The Canvas Laugh Factory, The Comedy Store and with East India Comedy. He also performed in San Francisco for a pledge drive sorted out by American India Foundation.

Most recently, he has also been a featured comedian on Netflix’s ‘Comedians of the World’ series. Atul’s comedy mostly discusses on subjects like Indian Culture, Bollywood, Masculinity, Human behavior, Nationalism, Casteism, Current events, Indian politics, Political alienation, Racism, Religion, Psychology, Social issues. It’s going to be a night full of laughs!

GET YOUR TICKETS NOW!


TICKETS:

Early-bird: (Mar 1 - Mar 7)

S$45, S$55* & S$70*

Reserved Seating: (Mar 8 onwards)

S$50*, S$60* & S$75*

*Excluding SISTIC Booking Fee

data.body:
This exhibition showcases the work of leading Southeast Asian modernist Latiff Mohidin, who was born in Malaysia and began his artistic practice in Singapore. Focusing on key paintings and works on paper from his time in Berlin (1961–1964) and iconic Pago Pago series (1964–1968), it situates Mohidin’s practice within Centre Pompidou’s permanent galleries. #11;

First presented at Centre Pompidou, Paris in February 2018, Latiff Mohidin: Pago Pago was the second co-curated exhibition by Centre Pompidou and National Gallery Singapore, the first being Reframing Modernism in 2016.

#11;It was Centre Pompidou’s first focused exhibition on a Southeast Asian artist and the Gallery’s first travelling show. The exhibition then travelled to ILHAM Gallery, Kuala Lumpur in August 2018.


Curators: Shabbir Hussain Mustafa (National Gallery Singapore) and Catherine David (Centre Pompidou)


The actual exhibition dates have not been announced and will tentatively be on display from Dec 2019–Jan 2020
data.price: $20 (General admission) | FREE for Singaporeans and PRs
data.description: This exhibition showcases the work of leading Southeast Asian modernist Latiff Mohidin, who was born in Malaysia and began his artistic practice in Singapore.
data.name: LATIFF MOHIDIN: PAGO PAGO (1960-1969)

data.body:
See more through less at the first Minimalism exhibition in Southeast Asia, set across two sites: National Gallery Singapore and ArtScience Museum.

Led by National Gallery Singapore, the exhibition features over 150 works that explore the history and legacy of this groundbreaking art movement, which continues to inform a wide range of art forms and practitioners across the world today.

In presenting the first Minimalism-focused exhibition in Southeast Asia across two leading cultural institutions, visitors can expect a wide range of historical and contemporary works, immersive and site-specific installations, as well as interdisciplinary programmes from artists such as Mark Rothko, Carmen Herrera, Tatsuo Miyajima, Donald Judd, Anish Kapoor, Mary Miss, Olafur Eliasson, Margaret Leng Tan, Ai Weiwei, Mona Hatoum, Kim Lim, Charwei Tsai, Tang Da Wu, Jeremy Sharma and Lee Ufan.
data.description: See more through less at the first Minimalism exhibition in Southeast Asia, set across two sites: National Gallery Singapore and ArtScience Museum.
data.name: Minimalism: Space. Light. Object.

data.body:
Shilin Night Market (士林夜市) is one of the largest and most famous night markets in Taiwan for all things good. This April 2019, we are excited to introduce the Shilin Night Market concept to Singapore for the very first time! Experience a taste of Taiwan with elements of local twist in the north of Singapore! With a wide variety of Taiwanese and Singaporean street delicacies, creative eats, pop up artisan stores, arcade games, and even movie screenings, Shilin Night Market will be the most anticipated pop-up market of the year. So join us now to eat(吃), shop(逛), play(玩) and have fun(樂)! 

Shilin Night Market (士林夜市)
The Grounds@Kranji Carpark B at Singapore Turf Club
19-21 April 2019 & 26-28 April 2019
3.00pm - 11.00pm
data.description: Shilin Night Market is one of Taiwan's largest and most famous night markets. And for the first time, Shilin Night Market concept is coming to Singapore!
data.name: Shilin Night Market

data.body:
The most eagerly-anticipated K-pop music festival in the region, HallyuPopFest, returns this May for its second edition in Singapore. The best of Korean music and culture will converge at the electrifying K-pop extravaganza on 25 and 26 May 2019 at Singapore Indoor Stadium. Superstars SUPER JUNIOR, will be headlining the festival, along with wildly popular bands such as MONSTA X, NU’EST and WINNER.

In this year’s edition, a new segment, HallyuTown will also debut. It will function as the main festival square where HallyuPopFest’s much-loved Red Carpet event will be held. HallyuTown will be open to the public, offering a variety of Hallyu-related booths and activities featuring K-Food, K-Beauty and K-Lifestyle, as well as a dedicated Fan Support area for fans to show their love and support for their idols. Each event day, festival-goers get an all-in-one, day-to-night experience, starting with activities at HallyuTown, Showcase performances by up-and-coming K-pop artistes, the Red Carpet event, Artiste Engagement opportunities and finally our spectacular Evening Concerts featuring our headliner acts. The artiste line-up will boast a total of 15 performing acts including established boyband PENTAGON, top girl groups (G)I-DLE and OH MY GIRL, reggaeton group K.A.R.D, veteran soloist HYOLYN, chart-topping rock band N.FLYING, and talented rapper KANTO, as well as the next generation of K-pop music acts including GWSN, A.C.E, VERIVERY and TREI.

Each HallyuPopFest ticket gives festival-goers access to two concert events on that day - the afternoon Showcase that runs about 2 hours long, and the 3-hour Evening Concert where headliners will perform individual sets of at least 30 minutes each, making it a “concert within a concert”. For Category 1, 2 and 3 ticket holders who would like a more personal fan experience, they may opt for the HallyuPass for Artiste Engagement which gives them a once-in-a-lifetime interaction experience with an artiste performing that day.

HallyuPopFest will be the only K-pop music festival you'll want to attend this year. #AreYouReady?

Tickets available at Sportshubtix. 

More information at www.hallyupopfest.com

All information is correct at the time of publishing but subject to change.
data.description: The most eagerly-anticipated K-pop music festival in the region, HallyuPopFest (HPF) returns this May for its second edition in Singapore.
data.name: HallyuPopFest 2019

data.body:
Singapore’s representative at the 56th Venice Biennale in 2015, artist Charles Lim will present Proclamation Garden (2019), the third work in the Ng Teng Fong Roof Garden Commission series. For the first time, the landscaping of the Gallery’s roof garden will be completely transformed by an artistic intervention, displaying not only a greater bio-diversity of plant material but also delivering a knowledge-based inquiry into Singapore’s history of land reclamation, via narratives generated by plants found on reclaimed areas from Changi to Tuas.


Curator: Adele Tan
data.description: Singapore’s representative at the 56th Venice Biennale in 2015, artist Charles Lim will present Proclamation Garden (2019), the third work in the Ng Teng Fong Roof Garden Commission series.
data.name: NG TENG FONG ROOF GARDEN COMMISSION | CHARLES LIM: PROCLAMATION GARDEN

data.body:
The City Hall, formerly known as Municipal Building, has had a long and colourful history since its completion in 1929. The building was constructed to house the Municipal Council and its various departments, and later occupied by Japanese authorities during World War II, as well as post-independence government and ministry offices. Today, the City Hall forms one wing of National Gallery Singapore.

In City Hall: A Place for the People, audiences can look forward to an immersive multimedia experience that combines art with stories inspired by key events that took place within the grand City Hall Chamber. The exhibition runs from August 2019 through to August 2021, as part of the Singapore Bicentennial commemoration.


Curator: Suenne Megan Tan
data.description: Look forward to an immersive multimedia experience that combines art with stories inspired by key events that took place within the grand City Hall Chamber.
data.name: CITY HALL: A PLACE FOR THE PEOPLE (working title)

data.companyDisplayName: BASE ENTERTAINMENT MARINA BAY SUB PTE. LTD.
data.body:
From the producer of The Lion King, the beloved story of Aladdin comes to life in this spectacular new musical. Breathtaking sets, mind-blowing special effects, over 300 lavish costumes and a fabulous cast bring the magic of Disney’s Aladdin to life on stage. Featuring all the songs from the classic Academy award winning film, including “Friend like Me”, “A Whole New World” and “Arabian Nights”, prepare to experience the unmissable theatrical magic that is Aladdin.

Aladdin opens for its only stop in Asia in Singapore on 21 July at the Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands.
data.description: The Hit Broadway Musical
data.source: BASE ENTERTAINMENT MARINA BAY SUB PTE. LTD.
data.name: Aladdin

data.body:
Awakenings: Art in Society in Asia 1960s-1990s is a large-scale exhibition of modern and contemporary Asian art that examines how artists radically sought experimentation and change in art and society during this turbulent period. Co-curated by National Gallery Singapore, National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Korea, and The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo, with the support of the Japan Foundation Asia Centre, this exhibition features around 150 key works by leading artists from 12 Asian countries. Awakenings traces significant moments across the region when artists provoked new ways of thinking about and making art, critically engaging with major events such as the Cold War, the Vietnam War, independence and democratic movements, and globalisation.


Curators: Seng Yu Jin, Adele Tan, Charmaine Toh, Cheng Jiayun
data.price: $20 (General admission) | FREE for Singaporeans and PRs
data.description: "Awakenings: Art in Society in Asia 1960s-1990s" is a large-scale exhibition of modern and contemporary Asian art that examines how artists radically sought experimentation and change in art and society during this turbulent period.
data.name: AWAKENINGS: ART IN SOCIETY IN ASIA 1960s TO 1990s

data.body:
Building onto the success of the first edition, Gallery Children’s Biennale 2019 will take on the theme of “Embrace”, with a wish to distill the spirit of inclusiveness and signal the genuine welcoming of children and families to take part in the promise of endless possibilities offered in art. The second edition, which runs from 25 May until 31 December, will feature interactive, hands-on and multimedia artworks created by Singaporean and Southeast Asian artists.

The Gallery Children’s Biennale aims to inspire the imagination of young minds with artistic experiences that transform a child’s understanding of the world around them. It also aims to increase the level of art and cultural appreciation amongst the people in Singapore, making the Gallery’s content accessible to the public beyond niche art experiences.

The first edition of the Gallery Children’s Biennale – “Dreams and Stories” was held in 2017 and it successfully attracted close to 300,000 visitors. It also garnered international interest that an adapted version is currently presented at Staatliche Kunstsammlungen Dresden (SKD), Germany from 22 Sep 2018 to 24 Feb 2019


Festival Director: Suenne Megan Tan
data.description: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2019 will take on the theme of “Embrace”, with a wish to distill the spirit of inclusiveness and signal the genuine welcoming of children and families to take part in the promise of endless possibilities offered in art.
data.name: GALLERY CHILDREN’S BIENNALE 2019

data.body:
Wu Guanzhong (1919-2010) is one of the most significant artists of 20th century China. His distinctive style fuses Western and Chinese art traditions, and set a new direction for modern Chinese art. A prolific painter and writer, his works paved the way for younger generations of artists and continue to inspire many to this day.

Wu Guanzhong: Expressions of Pen & Palette invites you to step inside the artist's expansive world of painting and literature. It explores for the first time the intimate relationship between Wu's words and paintings through an intimate selection of works from the National Collection and major private collections.
data.price: General Admission | Free for Locals & PRs, $20 for Non-Singaporeans
data.description: Wu Guanzhong (1919-2010) is one of the most significant artists of 20th century China. His distinctive style fuses Western and Chinese art traditions, and set a new direction for modern Chinese art. A prolific painter and writer, his works paved the way for younger generations of artists and continue to inspire many to this day.
data.name: Wu Guanzhong: Expressions of Pen & Palette

data.body:
Singapore Cocktail Festival returns from 10 to 18 May 2019, with passes to the Festival Village at the Empress Lawn available at https://www.singaporecocktailfestival.com or connect with us on FB and Instagram at @SGCocktailFest.


2019 Edition


COCKTAIL PASSPORT - EVENTS AROUND THE CITY (10 TO 18 MAY 2019)

We gather a hit-list of 50 cocktail bars in Singapore - each presenting exclusive Festival cocktails at promotional prices. In addition, expect guest shifts, pop-up parties, special events, flight tastings and showcases, exclusive to the Festival.

Get promotions through the Cocktail Passport - now also available on mobile via the Sluggr app during the Festival period.



FESTIVAL VILLAGE @ EMPRESS LAWN (10 TO 12 MAY 2019)

Guest Bartenders

Showings from the Asia’s 50 Best Bars list expected in the Festival Village include Singapore’s very own Tippling Club (No. 7 in 2018), Jigger & Pony (No. 40 in 2018), Smalls from Bangkok, Thailand (No. 29 in 2018) and Keepers from Seoul, Korea (No. 47 in 2018) to present you acclaimed, award-winning cocktails.

Best of SG Bars

Your favourite haunts, all under one roof – Expect to meet Singapore’s best shakers and makers at Festival Village - IB HQ, Neon Pigeon, Origin Bar & Grill, Mitzo, Tess Bar & Kitchen, CIN CIN and new contenders – Brass Lion Distillery and The Monarchy Cocktail Bar and more!

Spirit Brand Experiences

Leading brands such as Four Pillars Gin, Monkey 47, Hendrick’s Gin and Sabatini Gin among many others will return with immersive cocktail pop-up experiences.

Artisanal Tasting Room + Food Street

At the Artisanal Spirits Tasting Room, sip on unique spirits such as Skin Gin, Apoteca Gin, Black Cow, Codigo 1530, Maracatu Cachaca and more. Enjoy delicious bites at the Food Street, featuring establishments such as Como Cuisine.

Barstylez International Bartender Championship

A new addition to the Festival Village is the adrenaline-fuelled 3-day live competition, where over 60 bartenders from more than 25 countries compete in two categories – ‘Flairing’ (International) and ‘Cocktail’ (Asia).

Music & Entertainment

Shake your booty to R&B and Soul (Friday, 10 May), Retro (Saturday, 11 May) and Afrobeat (Sunday, 12 May) - from the likes of Brendon P (Doomph), Tirso (Matteblacc), Joshua P, Olle Des and Ya5th of retro club Nineteen80 as well as veteran selectors Ramesh K and Anand (Beatroot) to take you on a world music journey.

Visit https://www.singaporecocktailfestival.com for updates and news!
data.description: Asia's Largest Celebration of Cocktails!
data.name: SG Cocktail Festival

data.body:
Focusing on a man caught up in a tangled love affair, Florian Zeller’s The Truth is a hard-hitting examination of friendship, suspicion and deceit. In a new version by Christopher Hampton (Les Liaisons Dangereuses), who also delivered new versions of The Father and The Mother, The Truth is a biting new play that discovers what happens when the truth is finally uncovered.

Alice and Michel are having an affair. Michel’s wife, Laurence has been asking him difficult questions. Alice’s husband, Paul, is Michel’s best friend. As deceits intertwine, the two couples find themselves lost in a maze of who-told-who-what, where each loving lie seems more necessary and each confession more indiscreet.

A brilliantly cruel comedy of the hypocrisies which hold society together, Florian Zeller’s The Truth, premiered at the Menier Chocolate Factory, London, in 2016, in association with Theatre Royal Bath Productions. The Truth is “a devious must-see” (The Guardian) you do not want to miss.

"Unbelievably good" - The Times

"Dazzling" - The Observer

address.buildingName: KC Arts Centre - Home of SRT

data.name: The Truth

data.body:
Over the years, SRT has presented and produced some of the most outstanding Shakespeare productions here in Singapore - from our Shakespeare in the park series, to Sam Mendes’ The Bridge Project. We are now excited to offer you a brand new way of experiencing theatre: for three nights only, catch a screening of Shakespeare’s biggest hits as produced and performed by the internationally renowned Royal Shakespeare Company (RSC). Each performance is followed by a complimentary sharing by a Shakespeare theatre veteran.


The Merchant of Venice

By William Shakespeare

Directed by award winning Polly Findlay

Wednesday, 12 June, 7.30pm

Approximate running time: 2hrs 15mins

In the melting pot of Venice, trade is God. With its ships plying the globe, the city opens its arms to all, as long as they come prepared to do business and there is profit to be made.

With the gold flowing all is well, but when a contract between Bassanio and Shylock is broken, simmering racial tensions boil over. A wronged father and despised outsider, Shylock looks to exact the ultimate price for a deal sealed in blood.


Hamlet

By William Shakespeare

Directed by Simon Godwin

Thursday, 13 June, 7.30pm

Approximate running time: 3hrs

Hamlet has the world at his feet. Young, wealthy and living a hedonistic life studying abroad. Then word reaches him that his father is dead.

Returning home he finds his world is utterly changed, his certainties smashed and his home a foreign land. Struggling to understand his place in a new world order he faces a stark choice. Submit, or rage against the injustice of his new reality.

Simon Godwin (The Two Gentlemen of Verona 2014) directs Paapa Essiedu as Hamlet in Shakespeare’s searing tragedy. As relevant today as when it was written, Hamlet confronts each of us with the mirror of our own mortality in an imperfect world.


Othello

By William Shakespeare

Directed by Iqbal Khan

Friday, 14 June, 7.30pm

Approximate running time: 3hrs

Othello is the greatest general of his age. A fearsome warrior, loving husband and revered defender of Venice against its enemies.

But he is also an outsider whose victories have created enemies of his own, men driven by prejudice and jealousy to destroy him. As they plot in the shadows, Othello realises too late that the greatest danger lies not in the hatred of others, but his own fragile and destructive pride.

After more than a decade working in film and television on projects from Star Wars to Holby City, Hugh Quarshie returns to the RSC to play Shakespeare's Othello. He was last seen with us in Faust and Julius Caesar (1996). Hugh will play opposite Lucian Msamati in the role of Iago, returning to the RSC following his role as Pericles in 2006. The production is directed by Iqbal Khan (Much Ado About Nothing, 2012).

address.buildingName: KC Arts Centre - Home of SRT

data.name: SRT Presents RSC Live - The Merchant of Venice, Hamlet, Othello

data.body: ULTRA Singapore is part of the greater Ultra Worldwide family, producer of 45 events in 20 countries across 5 continents. It is the only edition of the festival in Southeast Asia.  On the heels of its sold-out 2015 soft launch, ULTRA Singapore was upgraded to full festival status in 2016. Following a successful festival in 2016 which saw 45 000 attendees, ULTRA Singapore 2017 welcomed over 47,000 attendees from 60 countries to its iconic Marina Bay location on June 10th & 11th.  40 world class acts performed across Ultra’s triumvirate of the Main, LIVE, and Resistance Stages. Next year, we welcome the fourth edition of ULTRA Singapore, dates and venue to be released. Stay tuned!
data.description: Ultra Singapore is an outdoor electronic music festival that debuted in 2015 in Singapore as part of Ultra Music Festival's worldwide expansion, which has now spread to twenty countries.
data.name: ULTRA Singapore 2019

data.body:
The most eagerly-anticipated K-pop music festival in the region, HallyuPopFest, returns this May for its second edition in Singapore. The best of Korean music and culture will converge at the electrifying K-pop extravaganza on 25 and 26 May 2019 at Singapore Indoor Stadium. Superstars SUPER JUNIOR, will be headlining the festival, along with wildly popular bands such as MONSTA X, NU’EST and WINNER.

In this year’s edition, a new segment, HallyuTown will also debut. It will function as the main festival square where HallyuPopFest’s much-loved Red Carpet event will be held. HallyuTown will be open to the public, offering a variety of Hallyu-related booths and activities featuring K-Food, K-Beauty and K-Lifestyle, as well as a dedicated Fan Support area for fans to show their love and support for their idols. Each event day, festival-goers get an all-in-one, day-to-night experience, starting with activities at HallyuTown, Showcase performances by up-and-coming K-pop artistes, the Red Carpet event, Artiste Engagement opportunities and finally our spectacular Evening Concerts featuring our headliner acts. The artiste line-up will boast a total of 15 performing acts including established boyband PENTAGON, top girl groups (G)I-DLE and OH MY GIRL, reggaeton group K.A.R.D, veteran soloist HYOLYN, chart-topping rock band N.FLYING, and talented rapper KANTO, as well as the next generation of K-pop music acts including GWSN, A.C.E, VERIVERY and TREI.

Each HallyuPopFest ticket gives festival-goers access to two concert events on that day - the afternoon Showcase that runs about 2 hours long, and the 3-hour Evening Concert where headliners will perform individual sets of at least 30 minutes each, making it a “concert within a concert”. For Category 1, 2 and 3 ticket holders who would like a more personal fan experience, they may opt for the HallyuPass for Artiste Engagement which gives them a once-in-a-lifetime interaction experience with an artiste performing that day.

HallyuPopFest will be the only K-pop music festival you'll want to attend this year. #AreYouReady?

Tickets available at Sportshubtix. 

More information at www.hallyupopfest.com

All information is correct at the time of publishing but subject to change.
data.description: The most eagerly-anticipated K-pop music festival in the region, HallyuPopFest (HPF) returns this May for its second edition in Singapore.
data.name: HallyuPopFest 2019

data.body:
Building onto the success of the first edition, Gallery Children’s Biennale 2019 will take on the theme of “Embrace”, with a wish to distill the spirit of inclusiveness and signal the genuine welcoming of children and families to take part in the promise of endless possibilities offered in art. The second edition, which runs from 25 May until 31 December, will feature interactive, hands-on and multimedia artworks created by Singaporean and Southeast Asian artists.

The Gallery Children’s Biennale aims to inspire the imagination of young minds with artistic experiences that transform a child’s understanding of the world around them. It also aims to increase the level of art and cultural appreciation amongst the people in Singapore, making the Gallery’s content accessible to the public beyond niche art experiences.

The first edition of the Gallery Children’s Biennale – “Dreams and Stories” was held in 2017 and it successfully attracted close to 300,000 visitors. It also garnered international interest that an adapted version is currently presented at Staatliche Kunstsammlungen Dresden (SKD), Germany from 22 Sep 2018 to 24 Feb 2019


Festival Director: Suenne Megan Tan
data.description: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2019 will take on the theme of “Embrace”, with a wish to distill the spirit of inclusiveness and signal the genuine welcoming of children and families to take part in the promise of endless possibilities offered in art.
data.name: GALLERY CHILDREN’S BIENNALE 2019

data.body:
As Singapore’s annual pinnacle arts festival, the Singapore International Festival of Arts (SIFA) presents captivating and diverse works across theatre, music, dance, film and visual arts. First launched as the Singapore Festival of Arts in 1977, the festival has gone through several evolutions and inspired generations of arts lovers and practitioners. Today, the highly-anticipated festival is a high-point on Singapore’s arts and cultural calendar.

Under the helm of Festival Director Gaurav Kripalani from 2018–2020, SIFA continues its festival mission to champion the creation and presentation of Singaporean and international works. Festival House At SIFA 2019, The Arts House will once again be transformed into the Festival House. With meaningful engagement opportunities from artists talks, workshops, discussions and the festival bar—House Pour, the Festival House breaks down the walls between artists and audiences to create unique experiences and inspiring artistic encounters.
data.description: 3 exhilarating weeks of artistic adventures at Singapore's pinnacle arts festival
data.name: Singapore International Festival of Arts 2019

data.body:
Singapore Cocktail Festival returns from 10 to 18 May 2019, with passes to the Festival Village at the Empress Lawn available at https://www.singaporecocktailfestival.com or connect with us on FB and Instagram at @SGCocktailFest.


2019 Edition


COCKTAIL PASSPORT - EVENTS AROUND THE CITY (10 TO 18 MAY 2019)

We gather a hit-list of 50 cocktail bars in Singapore - each presenting exclusive Festival cocktails at promotional prices. In addition, expect guest shifts, pop-up parties, special events, flight tastings and showcases, exclusive to the Festival.

Get promotions through the Cocktail Passport - now also available on mobile via the Sluggr app during the Festival period.



FESTIVAL VILLAGE @ EMPRESS LAWN (10 TO 12 MAY 2019)

Guest Bartenders

Showings from the Asia’s 50 Best Bars list expected in the Festival Village include Singapore’s very own Tippling Club (No. 7 in 2018), Jigger & Pony (No. 40 in 2018), Smalls from Bangkok, Thailand (No. 29 in 2018) and Keepers from Seoul, Korea (No. 47 in 2018) to present you acclaimed, award-winning cocktails.

Best of SG Bars

Your favourite haunts, all under one roof – Expect to meet Singapore’s best shakers and makers at Festival Village - IB HQ, Neon Pigeon, Origin Bar & Grill, Mitzo, Tess Bar & Kitchen, CIN CIN and new contenders – Brass Lion Distillery and The Monarchy Cocktail Bar and more!

Spirit Brand Experiences

Leading brands such as Four Pillars Gin, Monkey 47, Hendrick’s Gin and Sabatini Gin among many others will return with immersive cocktail pop-up experiences.

Artisanal Tasting Room + Food Street

At the Artisanal Spirits Tasting Room, sip on unique spirits such as Skin Gin, Apoteca Gin, Black Cow, Codigo 1530, Maracatu Cachaca and more. Enjoy delicious bites at the Food Street, featuring establishments such as Como Cuisine.

Barstylez International Bartender Championship

A new addition to the Festival Village is the adrenaline-fuelled 3-day live competition, where over 60 bartenders from more than 25 countries compete in two categories – ‘Flairing’ (International) and ‘Cocktail’ (Asia).

Music & Entertainment

Shake your booty to R&B and Soul (Friday, 10 May), Retro (Saturday, 11 May) and Afrobeat (Sunday, 12 May) - from the likes of Brendon P (Doomph), Tirso (Matteblacc), Joshua P, Olle Des and Ya5th of retro club Nineteen80 as well as veteran selectors Ramesh K and Anand (Beatroot) to take you on a world music journey.

Visit https://www.singaporecocktailfestival.com for updates and news!
data.description: Asia's Largest Celebration of Cocktails!
data.name: SG Cocktail Festival

data.body:
LA Comedy LIVE is thrilled to announce RuPaul’s Drag Race Miss Congeniality and All Stars Season 2 Finalist, Katya Zamolodchikova is making her debut in Singapore with her brand new show, “Help Me I’m Dying” on May 12, 2019, at Shine Auditorium!

The hilarious queen is best known for her incredibly funny personas, characters, and appearances on various entertaining web series. Guaranteed to be a full on riot, this show is a must watch!

Tickets go on sale at 10am on Mar 25, 2019, via the official ticketing agent SISTIC, at www.sistic.com.sg and via the SISTIC Hotline (65) 6348-5555 and at all SISTIC Authorised Agents.

ALL SHOW INFO: https://www.la-comedylive.com/katya 

TICKETS:

VIP Meet and Greet: S$248*

Standard: S$148*, S$108* & S$88*

*Excluding SISTIC Booking Fee

VIP Meet and Greet include:

- 1 x best seat in the house.

- Meet and Greet and Photo Opportunity with Katya.

- Exclusive VIP laminate & lanyard.

- Poster.


Subscribe to our Mailing List for breaking show news!

http://eepurl.com/Olvxr

'Like' LA Comedy Live on Facebook

http://www.facebook.com/lacomedylive

Follow LA Comedy LIVE on Twitter!

https://twitter.com/lacomedylive

Follow LA Comedy LIVE on Instagram!

https://instagram.com/lacomedylive
data.description: Katya Zamolodchikova debuts in Singapore with her brand new comedy show “Help Me I’m Dying” on May 12, 2019, at Shine Auditorium!
data.name: Katya Live Comedy Show in Singapore 2019 (R18)

data.body:
Shilin Night Market (士林夜市) is one of the largest and most famous night markets in Taiwan for all things good. This April 2019, we are excited to introduce the Shilin Night Market concept to Singapore for the very first time! Experience a taste of Taiwan with elements of local twist in the north of Singapore! With a wide variety of Taiwanese and Singaporean street delicacies, creative eats, pop up artisan stores, arcade games, and even movie screenings, Shilin Night Market will be the most anticipated pop-up market of the year. So join us now to eat(吃), shop(逛), play(玩) and have fun(樂)! 

Shilin Night Market (士林夜市)
The Grounds@Kranji Carpark B at Singapore Turf Club
19-21 April 2019 & 26-28 April 2019
3.00pm - 11.00pm
data.description: Shilin Night Market is one of Taiwan's largest and most famous night markets. And for the first time, Shilin Night Market concept is coming to Singapore!
data.name: Shilin Night Market
